there is a link in the topic
you'll probably have to 'modprobe hfsplus' before you can mount it
or just 'sudo echo hfsplus >> /etc/modules'
you might want to add a line to your /etc/fstab with the users option
this hfs+ partition doesn't have OS X on it does it?
what's happened to me is every file I touch in linux has its owner:group changed to numbers which has to be fixed if you want to use the partition with OS X
ok it worked. is /etc/fstab only read at boot?
there's an option used with mount I think that remounts stuff in fstab, but I don't remember what it is
maybe in the initrd
